lefi.voice.client module

class VoiceClient(state: State, channel: VoiceChannel)

Bases: object

Represents a voice client.

async connect() → None

Connects the voice client.

async disconnect() → None

Disconnects the voice client.

is_connected() → bool

Wether the client is connected to the voice channel.

is_playing() → bool

Wether the client is playing.

property loop: asyncio.events.AbstractEventLoop
play(stream: lefi.voice.player.AudioStream, *, volume: float = 1.0) → lefi.voice.player.AudioPlayer

Plays an audio stream. If the client is either connected or already playing it raises an error.

Parameters:

stream (AudioStream): The audio stream to play. volume (float): The volume to play the stream at.

property player: Optional[lefi.voice.player.AudioPlayer]

Returns the current player. If no player is playing, returns None.

async voice_server_update(data: Dict) → None
async voice_state_update(data: Dict) → None

lefi.voice.player module

class AudioPlayer(protocol: VoiceProtocol, stream: AudioStream)

Bases: object

is_paused() → bool

Whether the player is paused.

is_playing() → bool

Checks if the stream is currently playing.

pause() → lefi.voice.player.AudioPlayer

Pauses the player.

play() → lefi.voice.player.AudioPlayer

Starts playing the audio stream.

resume() → lefi.voice.player.AudioPlayer

Resumes the player.

set_volume(volume: float) → lefi.voice.player.AudioPlayer

Sets the volume. The volume passed in must be between 0.0 and 2.0.

Parameters:

volume (float): The volume to set the player to.

async stop() → None

Stops the player.

property volume: float

The current volume of the player.

async wait() → None

Waits for the player to finish.

lefi.voice.protocol module

class VoiceProtocol(client: VoiceClient)

Bases: asyncio.streams.FlowControlMixin, asyncio.protocols.DatagramProtocol

connection_made(transport: Any) → None

Called when a connection is made.

The argument is the transport representing the pipe connection. To receive data, wait for data_received() calls. When the connection is closed, connection_lost() is called.

create_rtp_header() → bytearray
create_secret_box() → nacl.secret.SecretBox
create_voice_packet(data: bytes) → bytes
datagram_received(data: bytes, addr: Tuple[str, int]) → None

Called when some datagram is received.
